data.author: Emerson Knapp
data.message:
Fix circular dependency (#38)

Here's the situation (`<depend>` where not specified) : 
`rosgraph_monitor_msgs` -> (test_depend) `rclcpp` -> `rcl` -> `rmw_implementation` -> (group) `rmw_implementation_packages` -> (member) `rmw_stats_shim` -> `rosgraph_monitor_msgs`

Breaking the cycle in two places:
1. Remove `rmw_stats_shim` from `rmw_implementation_packages` group. It doesn't have to be there, it can be referred to explicitly where needed
2. Move the `rclcpp` test for QoS constants to `rosgraph_monitor_test`, so that the msgs package doesn't depend on it. It's a heavy dependency for a msgs package. While the release builds _REALLY_ shouldn't be pulling in test dependencies, that's the way it is and this structure simplifies things. The test package isn't even released.

data.author: Emerson Knapp
data.message:
Use DiagnosticAggregator instead of custom Analyzer (#16)

- Removes GraphAnalyzer
- Restructures published diagnostics, to be one per check, rather than one per entity - this matches the expectations of - the diagnostic aggregator
- Fix up tests to match new diagnostic structure
- Provide a launchfile and a configuration for a diagnostic_aggregator aggregator_node that does a sensible base aggregator setup
- Migrate mandatory and ignore frequency checks to the monitor, instead of the Analyzer
- Update README to explain the new usage pattern, including a driveby update to add a better overview of the package

Signed-off-by: Emerson Knapp <emerson.b.knapp@gmail.com>

data.author: Emerson Knapp
data.message:
RAII initialization of RosgraphMonitor (#12)

Since the GraphMonitor was initialized with an empty configuration, it could catch incorrect health conditions that were not cleared when a new config was subsequently set.

Instead allow passing a fully configured GraphMonitorConfiguration to get rid of that startup race condition.

Does not fully fix #7 but mitigates it at startup.

* Disables topic statistics checkin test when RMW_IMPLEMENTATION_WRAPPER not provided - rosgraph_monitor should still be somewhat useful when there aren't stats

---------

Co-authored-by: Troy Gibb <troy.gibb@gmail.com>
Co-authored-by: Joshua Whitley <josh.w@aionrobotics.com>
